articles.title: 'Out of control': Witnesses describe fatal Lisbon funicular crash
articles.summary: At least 17 people were killed and 20 more injured, some critically, Portuguese authorities say.

articles.summary: The UK and other allies hope to obtain clear US backing for their efforts to shore up Ukraine's defences.

articles.summary: In Vladivostok, a city on China's and North Korea's border, Russia's war on Ukraine looms large.

articles.title: Leveraging International Partnerships Is the Key to Supercharging the United States’ Global Nuclear Leadership
articles.summary: The momentum for nuclear energy has reached a new height in the United States, but the nation needs partnerships with allies to overcome some of the domestic supply chain shortfalls, such as large forging capacity and a strong financial foundation for enrichment services.

articles.title: China’s Economic Transition: Debt, Demography, Deglobalization, and Scenarios for 2035
articles.summary: It is a dynamic time for China’s economy: Its growth model of the previous two decades has reached its limit, and Beijing must now pivot. This report presents a clear picture of the economy Beijing wants to build by 2035 and the potential scenarios for how it might unfold.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: Why Is Renewing AGOA Strategic for U.S.-Africa Minerals Diplomacy?
articles.summary: The African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) is scheduled to expire in September. If not renewed, it would severely undermine U.S.–Africa minerals diplomacy, weaken American soft power, and push mineral-rich African nations to deepen commercial ties with Beijing.
